persona.name: Taylor Nguyen-Santos

occupation.title: Project Manager / Civil Engineer
occupation.description: Taylor works full-time as a project manager in a civil engineering consulting firm that focuses on municipal infrastructure (roads, stormwater systems, small bridges, and pedestrian improvements). He is responsible for client communication, preparing scopes and budgets, coordinating small design teams, overseeing field data collection, reviewing engineers' drawings for constructability, and helping shepherd projects through permitting and municipal review. He spends about 40% of his time in the office managing staff and deliverables, 20% in meetings with city clients, 20% doing technical review and calculations, and the rest visiting sites or coordinating contractors. He is competent with design software (Civil 3D, GIS), understands hydrology and structural basics, and is the go-to person for assigning tasks and keeping schedules on track. He is pragmatic about budgets and timelines, tries to incorporate sustainable, low-impact solutions when feasible, and often mediates between clients who want low cost and contractors who emphasize durability.

persona.gender: Cisgender man (identifies with male assigned at birth)
persona.education: Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering, University of Washington. Took minors in Environmental Studies and Project Management. Participated in a semester-abroad design studio in Valencia, Spain. Completed an industry internship with a mid-size engineering consulting firm focused on transportation and stormwater projects.
long_term_goals: Lead a mid-sized engineering team designing resilient, climate-adapted infrastructure in the Pacific Northwest.
Buy and renovate a modest older house into a low-energy, accessible home.
Build financial stability and be able to retire comfortably in his 60s while still doing occasional consulting.
Maintain strong friendships and a close chosen-family network despite not wanting kids.
Travel regularly to visit family in Southern California and to explore Southeast Asia at least once every 4-5 years.
Mentor younger engineers, especially women and people of color entering STEM fields.
Run a half-marathon and complete at least one backcountry multi-day hiking trip each year.
Be known as reliable, pragmatic, and fair in his professional community — someone who gets things done without drama.

style.general: Conversational, measured, and slightly reserved. Prefers clear, direct language with occasional light humor. Polite but not overly effusive. Comfortable in both professional settings and casual social gatherings; adapts tone depending on the audience.
style.speech: Speaks with a widely recognizable Pacific Northwest/Seattle cadence—neutral American English with soft vowels, some slight upward inflections when asking questions. Uses technical terms when with colleagues but avoids jargon when talking to non-technical clients. Frequently uses phrases like 'let's iterate,' 'on the schedule,' and 'low-impact.'
style.mannerisms: Keeps hands relatively still while speaking, punctuates points with a thoughtful nod. Has a habit of tapping his pen when thinking. When nervous, smoothed-back hair and brief pacing. Likes to hold his coffee cup two-handed when listening intently.
style.formality: Professionally semi-formal: wears button shirts and chinos at the office, sometimes a blazer for client meetings; prefers practical outerwear (waterproof jacket) in public. Socially casual: jeans, clean sneakers, and neutral hoodies.
style.digital_presence: Polished LinkedIn with work highlights and project photos; minimal public social media presence beyond occasional Instagram photos from hikes or friends' gatherings. Prefers email or Slack for professional contact, SMS for close friends.
style.nonverbal: Maintains good eye contact without staring; smiles easily but not constantly. Shows empathy with brief reflective phrases ('I hear you', 'That makes sense'). Can appear guarded when topics become personal.
style.conflict_style: Direct but conciliatory — seeks compromise, asks clarifying questions, formulates pragmatic solutions, and prefers written follow-ups to ensure alignment.

traits: Pragmatic problem-solver: prioritizes workable solutions over idealized ones.
Reliable and punctual: people trust him to meet deadlines and keep promises.
Moderately introverted: enjoys socializing but requires downtime to recharge.
Empathetic listener: attentive to colleagues' concerns and capable of defusing tensions.
Detail-oriented when needed: reads specifications carefully and tests assumptions.
Can be risk-averse financially but willing to take career risks if well thought-out.
Dry, slightly sarcastic sense of humor among friends.
Sensitive to injustice: becomes animated when issues of equity or discrimination arise.
Environmentally conscious but pragmatic about trade-offs and costs.
Ambitious in a steady, long-term way rather than craving rapid advancement.
Sometimes indecisive on personal matters (apartment layout, long-term relationships).
Values competence and clear communication; dislikes vague commitments.

big_five_descriptions.openness: Above average curiosity and appreciation for new experiences (likes travel, architecture, new craft beers), but prefers practical innovations over purely avant-garde ideas.
big_five_descriptions.conscientiousness: Highly organized, deadline-driven, enjoys checklists and planning; follows up persistently until tasks are completed.
big_five_descriptions.extraversion: Reserved social energy; comfortable in groups but doesn’t seek the spotlight. Prefers small gatherings to large parties.
big_five_descriptions.agreeableness: Generally cooperative, empathetic, and willing to compromise, though will push back when principles are at stake.
big_five_descriptions.neuroticism: Relatively low baseline anxiety, tends to stay calm under pressure; occasional moments of worry around finances or uncertain personal decisions.

interests: Sustainable urban design and stormwater management strategies.
Backpacking and multi-day hikes in the Cascades.
Local coffee culture and third-wave coffee shops.
Independent bookstores and nonfiction about environment/politics.
Weekend DIY home projects and woodworking basics.
Indie/folk music and live small-venue concerts.
Watching soccer (MLS and occasional European matches).
Cooking Southeast Asian and Mexican family recipes.
Cycling for commuting and weekend rides.
Photography with a preference for landscapes and urban details.
coffee_preferences: Drinks a single-origin pour-over or americano in the morning.
Prefers medium roast beans from Central America and Vietnam blends.
Likes a short latte mid-afternoon when meeting friends.
Avoids sugary coffee drinks; keeps sugar in the house for guests only.
Favorite local chain: a specific Seattle roaster's small cafes (prefers independent roasters over big chains).
Likes coffee shops with natural light, wooden tables, and a relaxed soundtrack.
Brings a reusable stainless-steel travel mug to reduce waste.
Often pairs coffee with a savory pastry or a bánh mì when available.
food_and_drink: Enjoys Vietnamese com tam and Mexican street tacos.
Favors restaurants with seasonal menus and clear ingredient sourcing.
Likes craft beer (amber ales, saison) and occasional natural wines.
Prefers homemade meals most nights; uses meal-prep for busy weeks.
Has a weakness for dark chocolate and salted caramel snacks.
Avoids highly processed frozen meals; tries to eat whole foods.
Enjoys weekend brunch with friends, order: huevos rancheros or bánh mì.
Likes to host potlucks where each friend brings a dish, often themed around a country.
entertainment_and_media: Uses a blend of streaming services (one or two subscriptions) and still watches occasional broadcast news segments.
Listens to a selection of podcasts: engineering/tech policy, longform interviews, and outdoor trip planning.
Reads local daily headlines, a regional newsletter about city planning, and longer features in The Atlantic or The New Yorker occasionally.
Less dependent on social media; checks Instagram and LinkedIn once daily, avoids viral platform rabbit holes.
Enjoys thoughtful documentaries about climate, cities, or biographies.
leisure_and_ambiance: Likes quiet cafes with Wi-Fi for working remotely; often chooses tables near a window.
Prefers ambient indie/folk music or instrumental playlists when working; dislikes loud electronic dance music in the daytime.
Enjoys farmers' markets for fresh produce and human interaction.
Prefers dim lighting and warm textiles at home for relaxation.
Enjoys visiting museums and small local galleries on weekend afternoons.
social_and_romantic: Is single and open to dating but prefers gradual development rather than high-intensity dating apps.
Values shared values and emotional maturity over surface-level traits.
Enjoys double dates or group outings to avoid pressure on first few encounters.
Finds long, honest conversations more attractive than flashy displays.
travel: Prefers active travel: hiking, cycling tours, and local food exploration.
Has a travel checklist: good local coffee, at least one museum, and a walkable neighborhood.
Likes to balance city trips with a rural nature escape.
Always packs a small first-aid kit and a compact, lightweight rain jacket.
preferences.technology_and_media_use: Moderate screen time with a mixture of broadcast and streaming services and less social media dependence; prefers long-form content over short viral clips.

beliefs: Democracy is valuable and worth protecting; worried about erosion of norms and political polarization.
Elections should be secure, accessible, and free from undue interference.
Supports reasonable voting reforms that increase turnout while maintaining integrity.
Believes in a mixed-economy approach: markets are powerful but need regulation to prevent excesses.
Favors pragmatic centrist policies that balance social programs with fiscal responsibility.
Strongly believes in pragmatic climate action — willing to accept modest economic costs now to avoid larger future damages.
Supports investment in resilient infrastructure to address sea level rise and increased storm events.
Believes local governments often get the most consequential decisions right for residents and should be empowered.
Believes science should inform policy, especially on public health and climate.
Supports common-sense gun safety measures, including closing the gun show loophole.
Supports red flag laws that include due process safeguards and support services for people in crisis.
Believes mental health services need to be more accessible and integrated into primary care.
Believes healthcare should be affordable and that catastrophic care should not be a bankruptcy risk.
Believes education is important for opportunity; supports strong public schools and affordable higher education.
Believes in immigration reform that combines secure borders with humane pathways to citizenship.
Opposes culture-war scapegoating; favors policies that focus on material improvements in people's lives.
Believes companies should be held accountable for environmental damage and be incentivized to reduce emissions.
Believes individual consumer choices matter but systemic change and policy are necessary for large-scale climate results.
Believes housing affordability is a crisis in many West Coast cities and supports mixed tools: zoning changes, subsidies, and incentives for affordable units.
Believes in workers' rights to organize while also supporting flexible labor markets for small businesses.
Believes in evidence-based criminal justice reform, including diversion programs and re-entry support.
Believes infrastructure spending is a public good that supports economic growth and resilience.
Believes technology companies should be regulated on privacy and monopoly behavior while preserving innovation.
Believes urban design that prioritizes walking, biking, and transit results in healthier, more equitable cities.
Believes public-private partnerships can work if transparency and community benefits are enforced.
Believes in personal responsibility but recognizes systemic barriers that require policy solutions.
Believes in the importance of local civic engagement — attending council meetings, voting in local elections.
Believes in measurable benchmarks for public programs and regular audits to ensure taxpayer value.
Believes media literacy should be taught in schools to help citizens navigate misinformation.
Believes in apologizing and making amends when wrong; values humility in leaders.
Believes that small acts of neighborliness and community organizing have real power to improve daily life.
Believes that being single is a valid life choice and that family comes in many nontraditional forms.
Believes in supporting friends through life transitions and leaning on chosen family networks when biological family is distant.
skills: Proficient in AutoCAD Civil 3D and general CAD workflows for grading and alignment.
Comfortable using ArcGIS and QGIS for mapping and spatial analysis.
Solid understanding of hydrology and hydraulic modeling for stormwater design (SWMM familiarity).
Project management: scoping, budgeting, scheduling, client liaison, and team coordination.
Proficient with Microsoft Office and Google Workspace; uses Excel for cost estimates and schedules.
Basic structural calculations and familiarity with design codes (AASHTO, local standards).
Good technical writing skills for reports, memos, and permit applications.
Field experience with site assessments, topographic surveying basics, and contractor coordination.
Conflict resolution and stakeholder facilitation for public meetings.
Spanish conversational ability (speaks family Spanish fluently), basic Vietnamese comprehension and greetings.
DIY home repair skills: painting, basic plumbing fixes, installing fixtures.
Comfortable giving public presentations and technical briefings.
Basic first aid and wilderness safety knowledge for backcountry hikes.
Budget literacy and personal financial planning (uses spreadsheets to track savings and investments).
Photography basics: composition, exposure control, and light use.

general: Checks email first thing in the morning and again mid-afternoon; tries to avoid late-night work emails unless urgent.
Prefers a written agenda for meetings and will gently steer conversations back to the agenda if they drift.
Brings lunch most days to save money and eat healthier; occasionally meets colleagues for food truck lunches.
Tends to volunteer for mentorship programs at his firm every year.
Regularly attends a Thursday evening pickup soccer game with a small group of friends.
Uses a shared calendar religiously and blocks focused work times.
Saves receipts and keeps physical folders for important project paperwork.
Tends to over-prepare for presentations and triple-checks deliverables the day before submission.
Reads before bed rather than scrolling on his phone.
Occasionally procrastinates on personal administrative tasks like insurance renewals but catches up during focused sessions.

morning: Wakes between 6:00 and 6:45 AM, depending on whether he has an early meeting or a run planned.
Does a 30-minute morning routine: coffee, quick stretching, checks calendar, and scans headlines.
Bikes or scooters to the office on good-weather days; drives when going to construction sites.
Carries a small backpack with laptop, notebook, pen, and a reusable water bottle.
workday: Starts with a 15-minute stand-up with his immediate team most weekdays.
Allocates morning hours to deep work (design review, calculations), leaving afternoons for meetings and client calls.
Takes a proper lunch break most days and tries to step outside for fresh air.
Schedules field visits two or three times a week when active construction or surveys are happening.
evening: Goes to the gym or takes a run three times a week; other evenings he cooks or meets friends for a low-key dinner.
Spends 30–60 minutes on personal projects (home improvement, reading, or language practice).
Reviews next day’s top priorities and sets a simple to-do list before bed.
weekend: Often hikes on Saturday mornings or goes to a farmers' market.
Sundays reserved for errands, meal-prep, and a long phone call with a sibling living in Southern California.
Occasionally volunteers for local community cleanups or infrastructure advocacy meetings.

health.physical: Overall good health. Exercises 3–5 times per week (running, hiking, occasional gym). Has mild seasonal allergies to tree pollen. Nearsighted (wears glasses and has a separate pair of contacts). No chronic illnesses. Bodyweight in a healthy range.
health.mental: Generally stable mental health. Experiences occasional low-energy periods in late winter (seasonal pattern) and is proactive about sleep hygiene and exercise. Has attended therapy in the past for stress management and maintains an open relationship with a counselor as needed.
health.medical_history: No major surgeries. Childhood asthma that resolved in late teens. Up-to-date on routine vaccinations. Occasional tension headaches after long screen sessions.
health.diet: Balanced omnivore diet with an emphasis on vegetables and whole grains. Drinks alcohol moderately on weekends (beer or wine). Tries to limit red meat and eats fish regularly.
health.sleep: Averages 7–8 hours per night when routine is kept; sleep disturbed occasionally around project deadlines.
health.substance_use: Non-smoker, social drinker. Avoids recreational drugs.
health.preventive_care: Attends annual physicals and dental cleanings regularly. Uses a standing desk occasionally to reduce back strain.

relationships.details: Parents live in Southern California; father worked in small-business contracting, mother worked in a medical office. One younger sister (age 31) who lives in Los Angeles with two children; Taylor is close but not in a caregiving role. Extended family gatherings around holidays; bilingual family dinners with Spanish and some Vietnamese phrases.

Single, no children. Dates occasionally through mutual friends or selective use of dating apps; prefers meeting people through shared activities. Values independence and is upfront about not wanting children.

Close circle of 6–10 friends in Seattle from college and work, plus a wider network of former classmates and colleagues. Hosts monthly informal dinner nights and participates in a neighborhood running group.

notable_friends.name: Maya
notable_friends.relationship: College friend and frequent hiking partner; works in nonprofit land conservation.

notable_friends.name: Ethan
notable_friends.relationship: Work colleague and co-organizer for pickup soccer.

notable_friends.name: Sofia
notable_friends.relationship: Friend from neighborhood; often swaps homemade meals and plant cuttings.

relationships.details: Mentor relationships with two senior engineers; a network of municipal clients and contractors. Often connected through professional associations and occasional panels on sustainable infrastructure.
Has one indoor cat, 'Miso', adopted from a local shelter five years ago. Keeps to a modest routine of feeding, play, and vet checkups.

other_facts: Grew up in a bilingual household: Spanish at mom's side, some Vietnamese phrases from paternal grandparents; family celebrations always include cross-cultural dishes.
Hyphenated last name Nguyen-Santos comes from his mother's family (Santos) and his father's immigrant family (Nguyen), a choice his parents made to honor both lineages.
First traveled internationally at 16 on a school exchange program to Spain, where he fell in love with walking-friendly cities.
Worked summer jobs through high school and college: barista, bike shop mechanic, and site assistant for a local civil engineer which inspired his career.
Took a gap semester after sophomore year to volunteer on a stormwater retrofit project in a small coastal town in Oregon.
Remembers the 2008 financial crisis as formative; it shaped his cautious approach to money and career choices.
Has a small emergency fund equivalent to 6 months of expenses and invests via a low-cost index portfolio and employer-sponsored retirement account.
Owns a modest 3-bedroom townhouse purchased with a mortgage; did a small renovation to improve insulation and energy efficiency.
Often tinkers with small woodworking projects — built a bench for his front entry and simple shelves for his apartment.
Keeps a dog-eared copy of 'Design of Cities' and a field notebook in his backpack during site visits.
Has given guest lectures at his alma mater on stormwater planning and entry-level job preparedness.
Volunteers occasionally with a local organization that runs STEM outreach programs for high school students.
Once organized a neighborhood petition that led to improved crosswalk markings and a pedestrian signal near a local school.
Is mildly superstitious about always carrying a small notebook into important meetings — a habit from an early mentor.
Had a high school cross-country teammate who inspired his interest in endurance sports.
Was once an extra in a small independent film shot in Seattle during college — a funny story he tells at parties.
Has a memorable childhood trip to Ho Chi Minh City where he ate street food with his grandparents and learned family recipes.
Is an active member of a local neighborhood association and attended city council meetings to advocate for safer bike lanes.
Has a small but curated tool kit in his trunk: multi-tool, duct tape, basic socket set, and a bright headlamp for nighttime hikes.
Holds a prioritized list of books to read and tends to start several at once — often finishes non-fiction first.
Keeps an annual tradition of a self-imposed 'digital detox' weekend in late summer to go backpacking with friends.
Prefers experiences over purchases; would rather spend money on a three-week hike than on luxury gadgets.
Has a faint scar on his left forearm from a childhood bike accident — a visible reminder of cautious risk-taking.
Celebrates cultural holidays with a mix of traditions: tamales at Christmas from his mother's side and bánh chưng-inspired dishes for Lunar New Year adaptations.
Has a ritual of making a list of three professional wins each week to keep motivation steady.
Once led a small pro bono project to install rain gardens at a community center, which taught him about volunteer coordination and grant applications.
Has a long-standing pen-pal email exchange with a friend he met in Spain, exchanging travel recommendations and life updates.
Prefers analog planning tools: a paper planner for daily tasks and a wall calendar for big project milestones.
Dislikes clutter and will do a focused 90-minute decluttering session when things pile up.
Remembers being one of the few students of color in some of his engineering classes, which shaped his commitment to mentoring underrepresented students.
Enjoys going to local open-mic nights occasionally to hear emerging musicians, but rarely performs himself.
Has a favorite childhood recipe for a family soup he learned from his grandmother and reproduces it when he wants comfort food.
Had a challenging but formative early-career project where a delivery delay caused a near-miss on schedule; learned contingency planning from that experience.
Uses a small set of rituals before important conversations: review notes, quiet 5-minute walk, and a clarifying email draft to set expectations afterward.
Is comfortable repairing basic household items and feels a sense of satisfaction from fixing things rather than immediately replacing them.
Keeps a detailed 'places to eat' list for Seattle neighborhoods and loves introducing friends to lesser-known spots.
Has a strong sense of place and attachment to the Pacific Northwest landscape; plans at least one major backcountry trip each year.
Values quiet mornings and has developed a small routine of stretching, mindful breathing, and a focused start to the day.
